## Probability of Poker Hands ##

A hand in Texas Hold'em consists of 5 cards from a deck of 52 cards. A hand may fall into one of the following categories. We are going to compute the probability of each category.

First, the number of all possible hands is

### Pair: exactly one pair of equal rank cards ###

1. The number of possibilities for the ranks of the pair is
2. The number of possibilities for the suits of the pair is
3. The three other cards have three ranks different from the pair, the number of possibilities for their ranks is
4. And they can have any suit, thus the number of possibilities of their suites is
5. Thus the number of hands with exactly one pair is
6. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands

----

### Two Pairs ###

1. The number of possibilities for the ranks of the two pairs is
2. The number of possibilities for the rank of the single is
2. The number of possibilities for the suites of the two pairs is
3. The number of possibilities for the suite of the single is
4. Thus the number of hands with exactly two pairs is
5. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands

----

### Three of A Kind ###

1. The number of possibilities for the rank of the triple is
2. The number of possibilities for the ranks of the other two singles is
2. The number of possibilities for the suites of the triple is
3. The number of possibilities for the suite of the two singles is
4. Thus the number of hands with three of a kind is
5. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands

----

### Straight : Five cards in sequence, but not all of the same suite ###

1. The ranks of a straight is one of (Ace,2,3,4,5) ... (10,J,Q,K,Ace), so the number of possibilities for the ranks of a straight is
2. The suits can be anything other than all equal, so the number of possibilities for the suits of a straight is
4. Thus the number of hands that is a straight is
5. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands

----

### Flush: Cards of the same suite, but not in order ###

1. The number of possibilities for the suit is
2. The ranks can be anything except those that are in order. The number of all possible ranks for a hand of the same suit is
Among these, the number of hands whose ranks are in order is
So the number of possible ranks of a flush is
4. Thus the number of hands that is a flush is
5. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands

----

### Full House: 2 of one rank and 3 of another rank ###

1. The number of possibilities for the rank of the triple is
2. Given the rank of the triple, the number of possibilities for the rank of the pair is
2. The number of possibilities for the suite of the triple is
3. The number of possibilities for the suite of the pair is
4. Thus the number of hands that is a full house is
5. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands

----

### Four of A Kind ###

1. The number of possibilities for the rank of the quadruple is
2. Given the rank of the quadruple, the number of possibilities for the rank of the single is
2. The number of possibilities for the suite of the quadruple is
3. The number of possibilities for the suite of the single is
4. Thus the number of hands that is a four-of-a-kind is
5. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands

----

### Straight Flush = straight + flush: all same suite and in order ###

1. The number of possibilities for the suites of a straight flush is
2. The number of possibilities for the ranks of a straight flush is
4. Thus the number of hands that is a four-of-a-kind is
5. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands

----

### Royal Flush: straight flush with an ace high ###

1. The number of possibilities for the suites of a royal flush is
2. The number of possibilities for the ranks of a royal flush is
4. Thus the number of hands that is a four-of-a-kind is
5. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands
